greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = sum of all the remainders when n is divided by positive integers less than and coprime to n.
link: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(8) = 6. The remainders when 8 is divided by the coprime numbers 1, 3, 5 and 7 are 0, 2, 3 and 1, whose sum = 6.
mathematica: a[n_] := Sum[If[GCD[i, n]>1, 0, Mod[n, i]], {i, 1, n-1}]
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Jan 29 2002
